Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) include over 6,000 sets of Automatic Traffic Signals (ATS), over 1000 CCTV cameras, our road tunnel traffic control equipment and many items of information, detection and enforcement equipment such as safety cameras and Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras. You will play an integral part in designing changes to these systems, overseeing the implementation of these changes and ensuring the systems continue to operate safely. Your daily  tasks are varied and could include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Checking the quality of planned or reactive maintenance carried out by our supply chain","Redesigning a traffic signal junction so it can accommodate changes, perhaps as because of a new shopping development","Analysing fault trends on our ITS equipment, proposing and engaging improvement measures","Working with our ITS and civil contractors to make sure that changes (like implementing Cycle Superhighways) to the network are delivered with minimal disruption to the travelling public\u003cbr /\u003ePlacements: You'll work in a number of placements during the scheme and will get on-the-job experience with the full support of leading industry professionals."]}

On this varied and challenging apprenticeship you'll gain a BTEC Level 3 Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering as well as a Level 3 NVQ Extended Diploma in Engineering Technical Support. Through a combination of on-the-job learning and classroom training you'll develop a diverse knowledge and a wide range of skills needed for a successful career.
Whether it's working with internal teams, liaising with external suppliers, or getting involved in large or complex projects, you'll need to:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Demonstrate an interest in electrical/electronic engineering, and issues currently affecting transport in London","Have, and show, excellent organisational and problem-solving skills","Understand and balance the interests of different groups affected by engineering works and on-going operational activity"]}

The challenges we'll set will push you to achieve things you can genuinely be proud of. By the end of the scheme you should be well positioned to take on a junior Engineering, Operations, or even Project Management role at TfL.
Learn more about the benefits  for all of our apprenticeships schemes, and find out exactly what we're looking for.

If you're successful you'll have to pass pre-employment checks before joining. These will include reference checks, qualifications checks, right to work in the UK and in some cases a medical and a Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check.
